name: Rainy Days Galore
title: Most Rainfall in the World
description: Colombia experiences an average precipitation of 3240 mm per year, making it one of the wettest countries globally as of 2021.

name: Financial Inflows
title: Significant IMF Financial Inflows
description: In 2020, Colombia received net financial flows from the IMF amounting to $5.22 billion, indicating strong international financial support.

name: Business-Friendly Colombia
title: High Quality of Business Entry Regulations
description: Colombia scored 96.6 in the Business Entry Pillar for regulatory quality in 2024, showcasing its conducive environment for starting businesses.

name: Tax Revenue Powerhouse
title: High Revenue from Taxes on Goods and Services
description: In 2023, Colombia collected 119 trillion LCU from taxes on goods and services, reflecting a robust taxation system.

name: Debt Dynamics
title: High Net Incurrence of Liabilities
description: Colombia's net incurrence of liabilities reached 84.35 trillion LCU in 2023, highlighting significant financial obligations.

name: Surgical Savvy
title: High Number of Surgical Procedures
description: With 27,385 surgical procedures per 100,000 population in 2015, Colombia demonstrates a strong healthcare capacity.

name: Child Labor Concerns
title: High Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, 15.23% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, indicating a need for improved child labor policies.

name: Safety Net Struggles
title: Inadequate Social Safety Net
description: In 2022, only 0.69% of the total welfare of beneficiary households was covered by social safety net programs, indicating a significant gap in social protection.

name: Investment Dilemma
title: Negative Investment in Nonfinancial Assets
description: In 2016, Colombia experienced a negative net investment in nonfinancial assets, amounting to -4,257,815,123,537 LCU, highlighting challenges in asset growth.

name: Inventory Woes
title: Decline in Inventory Changes
description: By 2023, Colombia faced a significant decrease in inventory changes, with a value of -59,417,000,000,000 LCU, reflecting economic challenges.

name: Unemployment Coverage Gap
title: Limited Unemployment Benefits Coverage
description: In 2022, unemployment benefits and ALMP covered only 0.14% of the population, indicating limited support for the unemployed.

name: Cultural Shift Needed
title: Low Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, only 3.1% of women believed a husband was justified in beating his wife for any reason, indicating a positive cultural stance against domestic violence.
